result.execSummary:
The defendant Rafael J Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rafael J Hernandez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rafael J Hernandez was found guilty of Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, out of up to 25% prison funds and wages.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
*Restitution  set at zero.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with 14CF4647, but consecutive to any other sentence.
-Defendant does qualify for the  Challenge Incarceration Program and the  Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving five (5) years Initial Confinement in cases 15CF1342 and 14CF4647.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED/HSED.
Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No  contact with the victim Nicholas B., and the coactors Pierre Marshall.  Contact with Victoria Cintron at the agent's discretion.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Conditons of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.

The Court ordered no DNA sample, and no DNA surcharge on this case as it has been ordered in case 14CF4647.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armor or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

12/11/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Defendant Rafael J Hernandez in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Rafael J Hernandez in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.   

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 10 years, concurrent to 14CF4647 but consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 6 years with credit for 82 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
  
*
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim:  Nicholas B., and the co-actors:  Pierre Marshall.  Contact with Victoria Cintron at the agent's discretion.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school dipoma or GED/HSED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

- The Court ordered no DNA sample and no DNA surcharge on this case, as it has been ordered in case 14CF4647.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armour or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 5 years initial confinement in cases 15CF1342 and 14CF4647.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Received and filed on behalf of the defendant.
JusticePoint Discharge Summary received and filed.

Defendant Rafael J Hernandez in court with attorney Matt Last.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Defendant would like to enter a projected guilty plea.  

AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNT 3:
On motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 3 dismissed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Final pre-trial conference held.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on November 2, 2015 at 9:00 am in Branch 26.
